intro: Cordia guazumifolia, commonly known as the Guanabana or soursop, is a tropical plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces a fruit with a spiky exterior. The fruit contains a white, juicy pulp with numerous black seeds. It is widely cultivated for its edible fruit and has various traditional medicinal uses.
